intro: Crocus katrancensis, commonly known as the Anatolian crocus, is a species of flowering plant native to Turkey. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its striking violet-blue flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and prefers well-drained conditions. Its bulbs are adapted to survive in harsh climates, and it is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
